headline: Chicken Marsala Over White Rice
description: Chicken breast cutlets are lightly fried, then finished in a savory mushroom and red wine sauce. This meal is easy enough for a weeknight, but elegant enough to impress company. Serve over hot cooked rice.
name: Chicken Marsala Over White Rice
recipeIngredient: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken cutlets, pounded to 1/4-inch thickness
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring the rice and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes. Set rice aside.
In a large bowl, whisk the flour with salt, black pepper, and oregano. Gently press the chicken breasts into the flour mixture to coat, and shake off the excess flour.

Heat the olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Arrange the chicken in the skillet and cook until the chicken is no longer pink inside and golden brown outside, 5 to 8 minutes per side. Drain the cooked chicken on a paper towel-lined plate.

Melt the remaining 1 tablespoon butter in the same skillet over medium heat while scraping up any brown bits with a spoon. Stir in the garlic; cook and stir until fragrant. Add the mushrooms, and cook and stir until they are tender and have released their liquid, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper, then stir in the Marsala wine and chicken stock.

Transfer the chicken back to the skillet, and spoon sauce over chicken pieces. Increase heat to medium-high, and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the the sauce is thickened, about 5 minutes more. Serve the chicken and sauce over the cooked rice.

review.reviewBody: I don't use alcohol in my cooking so wouldn't use the marsala. Ordinarily I'd have used chicken broth. What would I use for the marsala? I don't want to spoil the flavour. Could somebody reply?üôÇ

I think the recipe was written after the fact and not re-tested. If a novice cook tried it, I doubt it would be a success. Three problems. If you cook a chicken cutlet on medium-high heat for 8 minutes a side, it will be shoe leather. Even 5 minutes is too much. I'd suggest 4 mins each side. Second, you can't "scrape up the brown bits" after adding more butter! Deglazing requires liquid. The time to "scrape up the brown bits" is after adding the Marsala and stock. Third; in order to thicken the sauce, it should be simmered UNCOVERED (unless you want to wait an couple of hours for dinner.)

I've never had Chicken Marsala before so I didn't know what to expect. I wanted a savory chicken recipe instead of a spicy one, as so many chicken recipes are. This was very tasty and fit the bill. I made the flour mixture in a ziplock bag and shook the cutlets around in it. I then refrigerated the bag for awhile to let the flour stick better. It isn't quite as messy either. I used canned mushrooms because I had them. The recipe makes very little sauce, especially once it's reduced and thickened a bit. I'll double it next time. I'll make it again to perfect it.

Merged a couple of recipes and added heavy cream. Also neither my wife no I are mushroom people and might even have a slight allergy ... so I substituted chunky chopped zucchini and summer squash and it was delicious.
Easy and delicious. My kids that don't like mushrooms gobbled it up.
Followed recipe as written. Quick & easy. Tasty dish. Will make this again.
Super easy recipe and big raves from family and company. It will definitely be a ‚Äúgo to recipe!‚Äù
Very easy and delicious. Will definetly make it again.
Put it in oven ten minutes. Delicious. Didn‚Äôt find Marsala wine used Kendall.

As I do when I try any new recipe, I followed the recipe to the letter and quite frankly, found the dish to be somewhat bland. I think it would be better if the Marsala and mushrooms quantity were doubled. Just lacking some... deeper flavor.
Great, very tasty and easy to put together, Thanks!

It was absolutely delicious! Big hit with my family. I tripled the mushrooms (Just because we absolutely love mushrooms) and doubled the amount of sauce, which I had to let simmer for a little longer. Can't wait to make it again!
I made this as directed & it was delicious! It‚Äôs a keeper.
Great recipe!! I followed the directions exactly and it was perfect. This is now my favorite Chicken Marsala recipe and I will definitely make it again!
Really easy recipe to follow and very quick. We only had chicken tenders on hand and they worked fine. Definitely will make it again.
It was quick, simple to follow and my family absolutely love it ! Ty
I loved it. Very simple recipe but the end result was great. The family loved it.
I forgot photos but this is so delicious, will make it again
Absolutely delicious just as written. A real treat.
Yum. Made it with GF four and it turned out great.
Made this tonight and it was good but not a lot of flavor for the chicken and no extra sauce when serving. I‚Äôll definitely make again but with a few changes such as less flour and more broth
We made this last night and it was delicious. E doubled the liquid receipes and used some chicken stock it was amazing
I made the recipe as listed and there was very little flavor.
What a delicious meal! I will make it again!
Delicious
So far the aroma is GREAT. Need another 30 minutes or so to see how it tastes!
super yummy
This was awesome! I used marsala wine from the liquor store not Holland house. Huge difference!
No changes! Yes, I will make this again

I am a big fan of chicken and mushrooms, especially when they are together in a dish, so I was excited to try this recipe! I added extra mushrooms to the recipe because of my love for them. I'm not a big fan of white rice on it's own but it really added some extra substance to this dish. I did cook the dish without the Marsala wine, and I thought it turned out fine. I noticed that some people in their reviews said that they preferred it without the taste of the wine anyway, so I figured it would be fine to omit from the recipe. I liked the way the sauce tasted and I definitely plan on making this again.
Delicious!
It is indeed simple to make. Even though I came up a little short on sauce, it was still enjoyed by the whole family.
It was all right. The texture and breading were great, but the seasoning is a little left to be desired. I would also do something to the sauce too as it was a little underwhelming.

Overall the flavor was great and I will definitely make this one again! I took the advice of some of the other reviewers and doubled the wine & chicken stock. That ended up being way too much liquid so I had to boil it down which took a lot longer. Next time, I'm just going to follow the recipe as is.
Really delicious. I doubled the sauce ingredients as well as the mushrooms though so that everyone could have a generous amount of sauce and I substituted egg noodles for rice. Everyone loved it.
My guest loved this recipe! I marinated the chicken with spices that I had on hand (garlic, thyme + more). I will make this again.
GREAT DISH
The chicken was very tough. I could not tell if I over or undercooked it. I did follow the recipe.
Followed recipe but doubled sauce ingredients and used. Baby Bella mushrooms was delicious
Made as directed but I doubled the mushrooms because my family loves them. It was a delicious meal!

Made this last night! Turned out very good. I followed receipe almost to the T. I added more garlic and oregano than called for, used less flour and doubled the liquid. Will for sure make this again. It‚Äôs simple, tasty and elegant looking.

I tried the the recipe it came out nicely and I'll definitely try it again but I'll cut down on the Marsala wine a bit or maybe try more garlic to offset the sweetness. Also I feel of you aren't using Marsala Wine and a nice brand NOT the stuff that says cooking wine then you really aren't getting the flavor thats meant for this recipe. Any other wine won't do it justice, sure it'll taste fine but I suggest using Marsala wine first to see the difference.
Very good.
This was good. Next time I'll double or triple the liquid ingredients for the sauce. Also, a 1/2 cup of flour is plenty to bread the chicken.
Delicious! I didn‚Äôt change a thing. The chicken was tender and flavorful. The only thing I would do differently is perhaps double the Marsala sauce. There wasn‚Äôt enough of it!
Didn‚Äôt have wine so I used red wine vinegar and a tablespoon of sugar and a little more chicken broth. Not bad.
No changes needed. It was delicious and so easy to make!

I added a shallot with my garlic and used fresh chopped spinach instead of parsley. I cut up my chicken into large bite size pieces as well. 
All in all, it was pretty good! I will be making it again for sure!

The chicken, mushrooms, and sauce came out absolutely amazing. I doubled the sauce and would even consider doing more next time. I was not, however, a big fan of this dish over rice. I would highly recommend making it with with pasta for a 5 star meal.
I made this, and I wasn't I'm impressed. next time I may serve over rice pilaf.
Awesome!
So delicious!
I made mine with smoked sausage. It was good but hard to keep lit.
Easy to make, great flavor. Next time, will halve the flour and double the wet ingredients.

This is a fantastic and simple recipe. I doubled the sauce because I like to let it condense down a bit to increase the flavours and allow it to thicken. I sauteed sliced onions before the mushrooms and garlic. I seasoned the chicken before dredging in flour. I also added a couple of sprigs of fresh thyme. I served it over mashed potatoes to soak up the sauce. Add a green veggie and your plate looks like it's from a restaurant. This is definitely a keeper!
Followed this recipe to the T, no flavor.

Very tasty dish. I concur with another review that if you're using the amount of chicken recommended (I cut the breasts in half horizontally to create the thin cutlets), use half the amount of flour. Keep the seasonings the same. Also, the sauce does not get very thick without some help. I used about 1-2 tbsps Wondra flour mixed with chicken stock then mixed into the sauce base to thicken to your liking. Otherwise, it was quite good!

Really good and easy! I doubled the recipe and was concerned that just doubling the sauce would change timing but it didn't. Once the sauce cooks a bit in the end, it just comes together! Just keep an eye on it.
I‚Äôll have to double the recipe next time!
Made this as directed except I used thin sliced chicken breast so no pounding was necessary. Great easy meal.
This was very easy to make, and my wife and I both enjoyed it. I plan to make it again.
tasted like cardboard
This was very bland and not very flavorful. I was really disappointed.

I substituted angel hair pasta for the rice. I used a lemon infused olive oil to coat the pasta before topping with the sauce. To extend the sauce I increased the amount of stock, butter, and Marsala wine. It was absolutely delicious.
My Italian "food critic" husband loved this recipe! He was very impressed although I did it with pasta instead of rice...it was absolutely delicious

This is a great recipe with good instructions. 

I cut the chicken into cubes because it's easier to manage and portion. The flour coating is very light and cutting the chicken allows it to better absorb the flavors. I used 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper and salt per recipe and made a double portion for my family of 4. I thought it was perfect, but was told that it needed more salt and less pepper.

I cook on a gas stove and kept the flame on high to more quickly thicken the sauce. It has a nice savory flavor.
Very goood, only thing is I would add double amount of marsala wine and chicken broth in order for more gravy sauce to mix with the chicken and the rice.
Kids loved it! Didn't add the mushrooms. Very good still.My husband liked it too!
I've been making this recipie for a long time now. Family still loves it. I like that its so simple & quick to make. This one has been a keeper & still is.
This is very good and simple to make ! Tastes great , I just didn‚Äôt use as much flour and slightly less wine ! Also next time I will double the sauce !
made it & loved it
Use half the flour, 1.5 times the mushrooms
This recipe was a total hit! I'll absolutely make this again.

My family really enjoyed this. I sliced the breast in half rather than pounding. We all agreed it needed a lot more mushrooms. I did add milk and a little cornstarch. The sauce did not get thick on its own. My chicken would have been way over cooked. Good recipe with some tweaking.

Sauce was tasty, did as others suggested and doubled. The chicken was tender but needed just another little something, maybe a bit more salt next time. Served over noodles with peas. Worth a try, I will make again. Love an easy clean-up

I have always disliked Marsala for some reason. 

I decided to give this recipe a try. 

I used "Holland House Cook Wine Marsala". 

This is a light red cooking wine , rather than white. 

It made the recipe. 

I have made it three times now and each time it is delicious.
Very tasty. I doubled the sauce; it cooks down quite a bit and we like extra sauce with rice. Will make this recipe again.
No flavour. I may make it again with the sweet Marsala.
l‚Äôll definitely do it again!
I had to substitute white wine for the Marsala wine. It was okay but we ended up adding a can of mushroom soup.

Added fresh green onions and a little dried parsley. Used 1 1/2 cups of chicken broth as well as same amount of the Marsala Wine. It was delicious but still could have used more sauce. Will make this again, but increase the sauce more than I did. My husband absolutely loved it.
This was very good. I doubled the sauce and added 2 TBL cornstarch to 1/2 cup of cold water, to add to the sauce BEFORE putting the chicken back in. It thickened up nicely.
Delicious! Quick & easy.. not a lot of sauce but it‚Äôs sweet, don‚Äôt need much. Definitely making again
LOVED IT. SO EASY TO MAKE.

Overall a very tasty dish! However a couple of things to note: First of all you certainly do not need 1 cup of flour to dredge the chicken. I used about 1/2 of that. Also, at the time you add the cooked breasts to the mushroom, broth & wine, you will need to thicken it a bit. I did not and had to take out the chicken and make a roux to thicken up the gravy. If you can figure out how to coat the chicken with more flour, perhaps it would have worked.
Wonderful, Easy prep and taste delish.

This dish looks nothing like the photo when it's done. The sauce is not milky like this, it's very much thin and wine colored. If you try to cook it down, btw, you will overcook the chicken. I'm disappointed.
It was alright; the sauce lacked flavor though. Made it as written.
My wonderful husband made this meal & it was delicious. Everybody in the family liked it very much.
Great recipe, definitely a keeper. Added 1 clove garlic and 1/2 tsp oregano when I added the shallots (I used green onions). Served over pasta. Delish! Hubby came back for seconds!
Simple and elegant recipe. The sauce didn't thicken to the consistency I was expecting; however, still attractive and tasty.
No changes

I have to say that the end product looks nothing like the picture. The sauce looks creamy like it has some half & half and there appears to be some parsley on it. None of this appears in the ingredients. I haven't eaten it yet so perhaps it will taste good
Not enough Marsala flavor. Have another recipe with more flavor. Won‚Äôt use this one again.

Family loved it and was upset I didn't enough! So what am I doing today, you guessed it , making more!!! Great recipe will
make for family gatherings.

LOVE will add onions next time, It will add more flavor. I added the rice at the end to the pan instead of putting on top, and think I might even through a bit of Feta in at the end. It was so yum and will add but a fab start!!!
it was great

I made this for my wife on Valentine's Day and we had an amazing dinner thanks to this recipe! So simple. It turned out great!

Next time I would add a bit more mushroom. They came out so flavorful that I was a little sad there wasn't any left. I also took a small wedge of lemon and lightly squeezed some lemon juice over the top of the chicken. The little bit of lemon really compliments the flavors in the chicken if you ask me :-) But to each his own!

Super easy to make. My kids and I loved it. Will def make this again. Now that I have a the items its a easy dinner to prepare. Just need to pick up chicken breasts and slice in half since hey come so thick.
